alert.note: Alert for Christian; Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian and Stone. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected. - This includes the following low water crossings... Silver Lake Branch at Highway U, Tory Creek at Highway O and Parchcorn Creek at Smyrna Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nixa, Ozark, Highlandville, Sparta, Fremont Hills, Selmore and Linden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
